Presidential Innovation Fellow

Commerce

The latest wave of web APIs was set into motion by Salesforce, eBay, and Amazon, extending the reach of their networks.

Mobile

The latest wave of web APIs was set into motion by Salesforce, eBay, and Amazon, extending the reach of their networks.

Data Sources

You have a spreadsheet or database that you need to make available on the web, within mobile applications, and partners.

Data Published to a Website

You publish the data to a web or mobile application directly from the data source, making it available on the web as HTML.

Portable Widget

Then you are in need of a widget that can be embedded on any other website, making the data available in new ways.

Partner Data Access

Then your partners need access to your data for their websites and application, expanding the scope of access to your data.

Mobile Applications

Then the need for making data available via mobile phones and tablets further expands the need for access to your data.

Devices

Then the need for making data available via mobile phones and tablets further expands the need for access to your data.

Existing API Development Lifecycle

A current API lifecycle can take an average of 3-12 months to deliver each version of an API, using a code first approach.

API First

Over the last five years more API providers are moving toward an API first approach when it comes to delivering their APIs.

Postman as an API Client

Postman is an API platform which began as an HTTP client, allowing developers to make calls to APIs via the web.

Path

Create a New API as a Path

To demonstrate, let's design an API for a public water systems dataset by creating a single path for our new API resource.

Add

Add JSON Example

Add an example to our new API request we have defined as a simple resource path, providing an example of it's response.

Save

Save JSON Example

Convert our CSV public water system data, convert it into JSON, and take 100 rows and add it as an example for this API.

Mock

Add Mock API

Now that we have a path, and an example of what our API response should look like, we want to add a mock for our API.

Configure Mock API

Next we will need to give our mock API a name, and then configure it mock the API we are working to define and design.

Mock URL

Mock API URL

Grab the URL for our mock API, so that we can add it to our API, allowing us to make requests and see it as the response.

Mock API URL

Mock API Response (JSON)

Now we can combine the mock URL with our API path, click send, and actually see the static response for our new API.

Mock API URL

Mock API Response (YAML)

Now we can combine the mock URL with our API path, click send, and actually see the static response for our new API.

Mock API URL

Mock API Response (CSV)

Now we can combine the mock URL with our API path, click send, and actually see the static response for our new API.

Add

Add API Documentation

With a mocked version of our API we can make it a little more tangible by publishing documentation for our API.

View API Documentation

Now we have API docs for our API, allowing stakeholders to see how it works, then download and run on their own.

Iterate on API Design

We can now share our mocked API and documentation, and then iterate upon the design of the API and schema.

Iterate Until Complete

Repeating each of the steps, sharing with stakeholders and gathering feedback along the way until it is ready to use.

Mock HTML Listings

Once we have our mocked API, we can share them with UI developers, allowing for HTML web interfaces to also be mocked.

Mock JavaScript Widgets

We can also share APIs with developers to mock up JavaScript widgets that will make data embeddable on any website.

Mock HTML Forms

We can also encourage the development of forms using the APIs, planning out which fields should be posted by users.

Mock Mobile Apps

Next, mobile applications can be mocked up using our new APIs, speeding up both API and application development.

Partners & Stakeholders

API first brings together all of stakeholders and allows everyone to participate and provide feedback for each API being designed.

API Testing

Making sure all stakeholders participate in defining assertions which become API tests used to validate each API response.

API Contracts

Using API tests to make sure all APIs meet the needs of all applications, and stakeholders using API contracts.

Deploy / Gateway / Manage

Using API tests to make sure all APIs meet the needs of all applications, and stakeholders using API contracts.
